column4: can anyone help me with uninstalling clamav and vmware? I get these error messages E: vmware-player: subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 1
E: clamav-base: subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 1
E: clamav-freshclam: dependency problems - leaving unconfigured
E: clamav: dependency problems - leaving unconfigured
try first "sudo apt-get --reinstall install vmware-player clamav-base"
: thanks, haven't been here in a while and I've forgotten all of the commands.
: I'm getting the same error messages.
edit /var/lib/dpkg/info/clamav-base.postinst (if there is such a file), and put a line saying  exit 0  right at the beginning of it, but *after* the line that says #!/bin/sh
: says I don't have permission to save the file.
you need to be root to edit it, use "gksudo gedit filename"
: now I can open the file but it shows as empty, when I know that it exists.
: it showed the contents if I went places>file system>var>etc but not if I called from Terminal.
: I just want to uninstall both clamav and vmware. would "rm -f <file name>" work...?
you must have mistyped something in the terminal, if it was shown in nautilus
